Generation VII.Sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
Generation VII.Moon: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking .
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Oranguru don't get along with each other, so they're always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.

Generation VIII.Sword: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Shield: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

Generation IX.Scarlet: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.

Generation VIII.Shield: Glimwood Tangle Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell , Motostoke Riverbank , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield Expansion Pass: Forest of Focus Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )

Generation IX.Scarlet: East Province: Tagtree Thicket North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ , 5★ )
Generation IX.Violet: Union Circle Tera Raid Battle Search ( 3★ , 5★ )
